slogan: Recon And Precision Targeting Object Recognizer
drag_drop: Drag and drop a photo or video here
brand_description: is a modern model for recognizing and accurately identifying military objects in photos and videos under challenging real-world conditions.
current_model: Currently, our model confidently identifies <1>soldiers</1> in various landscapes and weather conditions. The model is optimized for fast operation and integration into monitoring systems, UAV analysis, and situational awareness.
future_classes: In the future, we plan to expand detection classes:
ukr_context: The model is created with the Ukrainian context in mind and is available for testing and free use by Ukrainian defense structures.
team_desc1: We are a young team of enthusiasts developing solutions in the field of artificial intelligence and computer vision.
team_desc2: Our mission is to work for the benefit of Ukraine, implementing modern AI technologies to increase the safety, efficiency, and innovation of Ukrainian companies and organizations.
team_desc3: We are open to cooperation with other Ukrainian teams, startups, businesses, and government structures. Together, we can create a strong AI ecosystem for Ukraine's future!
video_stub: Video format is temporarily not supported, we are working on it.
unsupported_file_type: Unsupported file type. Please upload an image or video.
file_too_large: File is too large. Maximum allowed size is 10MB.
class_civilian_hint: Objects identified by the system as civilians. They have a non-militarized appearance, no weapons or military uniforms. This class is implemented to separate the civilian population from military targets.
soldier_hint: Living objects in military uniforms or with signs of combat equipment. Includes soldiers, shooters, vehicle operators. The class is trained on photos of infantry, military at checkpoints, in trenches, etc.
class_vehicle_hint: General class for wheeled vehicles that are not armored or specialized. Includes military pickups, trucks, light support vehicles. Covers both civilian cars in combat zones and military wheeled vehicles.
apc_hint: Wheeled armored vehicles. Includes armored cars, MRAPs, Humvees, wheeled APCs. All vehicles are armored and often used to transport personnel. In the model, separated from tracked vehicles.
lav_hint: Tracked armored vehicles that are not tanks. Includes tracked APCs, engineering vehicles, IFVs without turrets or with minimal armament. Usually have a smaller caliber or auxiliary purpose.
tank_hint: Full-fledged armored vehicles with a turret and a large-caliber gun. The class includes main battle tanks (T-64, T-72, Leopard 2, Abrams, etc.). The model is trained to recognize the silhouette, barrel, and turret.
ifv_hint: Tracked vehicles with medium-caliber weapons (usually up to 30 mm). Differ from tanks by smaller size, armament, and turret shape. Includes BMP-1/2/3, M2 Bradley, CV90, etc.
class_mrls_hint: Multiple launch rocket systems. Includes BM-21 'Grad', 'Smerch', HIMARS, M270, etc. The model is trained on the characteristic silhouette of launch tubes, often in a raised position, and chassis.
class_aa_hint: Air defense systems: 'Pantsir', 'Buk', 'Osa', NASAMS, IRIS-T. Characterized by the presence of radars, launchers, or anti-aircraft guns. The model is trained to recognize them as a separate class.
radar_hint: Radar stations. Can be standalone or part of air defense systems. Detected by round/flat antennas, rotating or elevated structures. Used for airspace monitoring.
class_heli_hint: Helicopters of various types — combat (Mi-24, Apache), transport (Mi-8, UH-60). The model is trained on the characteristic body, rotors, and tail unit.
class_plane_hint: Includes combat and transport aircraft: Su-25, Su-27, F-16, An-26, kamikaze drones with wings (if visible in the frame). The class is focused on recognizing the shape of the wing and fuselage.
